intro: Gaudichaudia uhdeana, commonly known as the Kauai hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs. Gaudichaudia uhdeana is considered an endemic species, meaning it is found nowhere else in the world.
